}} {{Album ratings
| rev1 = Allmusic rev1Score =  rev2 = rev2Score =
}} 'Cycles' is the tenth studio album by American rock band The Doobie Brothers,
released in 1989. (see 1989 in music). The album was reissued in 2002 by One Way
Records with two bonus tracks. The first "Anything for Love" was written by
Bobby LaKind with Eddie Schwartz and Zeke Zirngiebel. The second bonus track is
an exapnded version of The Isley Brothers classic "Need A Little Taste of Love"
that was included on the original album. http://www.allmusic.com/album/release/cycles-expanded-
mr0001230952
